results.title: Amateur
results.creator_credit: Hal Hartley, Ted Hope, True Fiction Pictures, UGC Images and Zenith Entertainment
results.brief_description: A quirky and absurdist comic thriller from writer/director, Hal Hartley. Isabelle (Isabelle Huppert) is an ex-nun awaiting an expected mission from God while making a living writing stories for pornographic magazines. She meets the kind and confused Thomas (Martin Donovan), who is suffering from amnesia and wandering the streets of New York in search of clues to his past, a past of viciousness and exploitation that only the appearance of his traumatized porn queen ex-wife, Sophia (Elina Lowensohn), begins to unravel. Intertwined with suspenseful thriller qualities and the subtlety of an unlikely romance, this film quietly spirals into a poignant tale of the pursuit of the reality of identity through memory and engagement with the past which leads sensitively to the inevitable tragedy of the final showdown.

results.title: Witchfinder General
results.creator_credit: Michael Reeves, Arnold Louis Miller, Louis M Heyward and Philip Waddilove
results.brief_description: The sinister subject of this film becomes apparent in the opening scene, where shots of an old woman being dragged, screaming, through the streets of a village are juxtaposed against those of a lone figure calmly tending the gallows on a barren, windswept hilltop. It is 1645, and England is in the grip of civil war. As law and order collapses, and unrest plagues the populace, cries of witchcraft begin to echo across the land. Soldier Richard Marshall (Ian Ogilvy) finally gains permission from John Lowes, the priest of Branderston, to marry his niece, Sara (Hilary Dwyer), as long as he promises to take her away to another village. As Richard returns to his regiment, Matthew Hopkins (Vincent Price) and his sadistic assistant, John Stearne, ride into town, seeking a priest who allegedly worships Satan. John Lowes is tracked down and tortured, until Hopkins lays eyes on Sara, and agrees to suspend the death sentence if Sara allows him to come to her bed-chamber and “question her”. In exchange for her uncle’s life, Sara agrees, and all is well until one night Stearne follows Hopkins to her home and learns why the priest has received a reprieve. While Hopkins is away on business in the neighbouring town, Stearne corners Sara and rapes her. One of the men who accused John Lowes of idolatry misinterprets the nature of this attack and tells Hopkins, who, in a fit of jealousy, orders the torture and death of her uncle. Richard hears of these hangings, and deserts the army in order to be by his bethrothed’s side. Standing in the midst of the ruined church, he marries Sara in a mock ceremony, and vows to avenge both her and her uncle by killing Hopkins and Stearne. Matthew Hopkins, menacingly brought to life by legendary actor Vincent Price, was a real-life witch-hunter who operated in the era of English general and Puritan statesman, Oliver Cromwell. This film, the last by director Michael Reeves before his untimely death in 1969, was such a great success (despite its low budget), that it spawned a number of imitators, including the horror classic, “The Bloody Judge” (1969).

results.title: D'artagnan's daughter = La Fille de d'Artagnan
results.creator_credit: Bertrand Tavernier, CiBy 2000, Little Bear and TF-1 Film Productions
results.brief_description: In this historical swashbuckling comedy/adventure set in France in 1654, a feisty young woman (Sophie Marceau), daughter of the famed swordsman D’Artagnan, cuts short her religious studies when she uncovers a plot to assassinate the young Louis XIV. Heading to Paris she persuades her father, now in retirement, and the three other original musketeers to fight alongside her to defend their country from the insurgent forces that threaten to throw the nation into disarray. A lush, lively film assuredly directed by Tavernier that pairs old-fashioned adventure with a contemporary knowing wit and a feminist sensibility. In French with English subtitles. Cast includes Philippe Noiret, Claude Rich and Nils Tavernier.

results.title: I Don't kiss = J'embrasse pas
results.creator_credit: Andre Techine, Jacques-Eric Strauss, Jean Labadie, Maurice Bernart, Bac Films (France), Cine Cinq, Gruppo Bruno, President Films and Salome
results.brief_description: Manuel Blanc is Pierre, a young provincial adolescent who leaves his village to settle in Paris and become an actor. However, the big city proves difficult and expensive and when Pierre loses his job as a hospital orderly he soon finds himself working as a street prostitute. As his dreams disappear and his soul becomes hardened, it is only through his love for the enigmatic Ingrid (Emmanuelle Beart), who also works the streets, that Pierre can hold on to any aspirations for beauty and love. But Ingrid belongs to her pimp and Pierre’s desire soon leads to an inevitable tragic conclusion. Utilising the conventions of melodrama - including the cliched story of the “whore with the heart of gold” - Techine builds a compelling and gritty story of underclass life on the streets. Shifting from almost documentary style examination of the lives of the hustlers, junkies and criminals in the Paris underworld, to highly expressionistic colours and mise-en-scene for the fragile love affair between Pierre and Ingrid, “I Don’t Kiss” becomes a rhapsodic and moving account of the damages inflicted by both poverty and fate. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: When night is falling
results.creator_credit: Patricia Rozema, Barbara Tranter, Alliance Communications and Crucial Pictures
results.brief_description: Camille, a professor of mythology at the Christian New College of Faith, and her boyfriend Martin are being pressured to marry by the principal of the college. When her dog dies Camille finds comfort with Petra, a sexy circus performer, who she meets at a laundry. As their friendship gradually develops into a love affair Camille’s life is turned upside down and she realises she must make a choice between a secure life with her fiance, or one of adventure, passion and uncertainty with Petra. Sumptuously filmed in lush colours, Rozema draws on the magic and drama of daring circus acts to symbolically convey Camille’s struggle to set herself free. Cast includes Pascale Bussieres, Rachael Crawford, Henry Czerny and Don McKellar Winner of Audience Award, Berlin Film Festival 1995.

results.title: The Spirit of the beehive = El Espiritu de la colmena
results.creator_credit: Victor Erice, Elias Querejeta and Elias Querejeta Producciones
results.brief_description: This hauntingly atmospheric mood piece is set in rural Spain soon after the Civil War. In the oppressive postwar atmosphere there is an unbridgeable gulf between the parents and children of the household. The parents have retreated into private worlds - beekeeping and an obsession with a ‘lost’ child. After seeing James Whale’s ‘Frankenstein’ at a travelling film show the children conjure the monster up as a playmate. In the mind of the imaginative and impressionable Ana the figure of a fugitive soldier fuses with the figure of the monster. Cast includes Fernando Fernan Gomez, Teresa Gimpera, Ana Torrent, Isabel Telleria. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Vigil
results.creator_credit: Vincent Ward, John Maynard and John Maynard Productions
results.brief_description: A family’s bitter struggle to eke out a living in the harsh environment of a high mountain valley has eroded the parent’s marriage. After the tragic death of her father, twelve-year-old Toss, in empathy with her grandfather’s dreams, compensates for a life of isolation by inventing imaginary worlds. The fragments of reality she perceives are put together according to her own logic. When an itinerant hunter begins work on the farm and is befriended by her mother and grandfather, Toss’s reality is thrown further into crisis. The landscape is centrally implicated in a world of nightmares and dreams. Cast includes Penelope Stewart, Frank Whitten, Bill Kerr and Fiona Kay.

results.title: A Man escaped = Un Condamne a mort e'est echappe = Le Vent souffle ou il vent
results.creator_credit: Robert Bresson, Alain Poire, Jean Thuillier and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Based on the true life account of Resistance fighter Andre Devigny, who was imprisoned and condemned to death by the Nazis, “A Man Escaped” is one of cinema’s truly poetic films, a study in both the psychology of imprisonment and loss of liberty, as well as a tense and involving study of how a man plotted his escape from one of the most heavily guarded prisons in World War II. As played by Francois Letterier, the condemned man’s initial fear and anger give way to a resolve and determination to defy his fascist captors. But, as his plans are disturbed on the eve of his execution, he achieves a transcendence by accepting the inevitability of fate, the need to trust another human being, and finally having the knowledge that by not surrendering his will - whatever the outcome of his escape - he has truly liberated himself from the enemy. Winner of the Best Director Award a Cannes in 1957, stunningly photographed by L. H. Burel, and featuring an evocative use of Mozart’s Mass in C Minor, this is universally acknowledged as one of Bresson’s supreme works. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Cyclo = Xich lo
results.creator_credit: Tran Anh Hung, Cristophe Rossignon, La SFP Cinema, Le Sept Cinema and Lumière
results.brief_description: This film depicts the bustle and brutality of urban life in modern Saigon, a city overrun by crime, violence, sex and madness. An 18 year old boy, nicknamed ‘Cyclo’, is trying to scrape together a living in the desperate poverty of Saigon, whilst living with his two sisters and grandfather. When his pedi-cab is stolen he is forced into the criminal underworld in order to repay his debt. Initially taking on small errands for a small group of thugs, he soon becomes entangled in far more sinister events. In Vetnamese with English subtitles. Cast includes: Tran Nu Yen-Khe, Le Van Loc and Tony Leung Chiu-Wai. (Awards: Flanders, 1995 and Venice, 1995)

When his pedi-cab is stolen he is forced into the criminal underworld in order to repay his debt. Initially taking on small errands for a small group of thugs, he soon becomes entangled in far more sinister events. In Vetnamese with English subtitles. Cast includes: Tran Nu Yen-Khe, Le Van Loc and Tony Leung Chiu-Wai. (Awards: Flanders, 1995 and Venice, 1995)

results.title: Shock corridor
results.creator_credit: Samuel Fuller and Allied Artists Pictures
results.brief_description: Peter Breck plays an ambitious reporter, Johnny Barrett, who decides to imitate an insane psychiatric patient in order to write an expose on conditions in a psychiatric asylum where a murder has recently been committed. He finds himself losing the grip on his own sanity when he confronts his fellow inmates who all exhibit paranoiac and delusional fantasies. Before long Johnny is no more sane than any of the other men inside. Samuel Fuller’s intense thriller is a searing and truly frightening dissection of American social malaise. Johnny’s fellow inmates all exhibit schizophrenic and psychotic behaviour that is reflective of the social divisions in their contemporary culture. A black man, so psychically disfigured by racism, believes himself to be a white man in the Ku Klux Klan; a man thinks he is a Civil War General because he can not deal with the stigma of being branded a “Commie”. Within the limitations of a B-movie budget, Fuller has created one of the finest and most caustic metaphors for the damage inflicted on the national psyche by the Cold War and the orgy of witch-hunts initiated by the McCarthy-era blacklist.
